alert.note: Alert for Koochiching (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:09PM CDT until June 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. Namakan and Rainy Lakes have both surpassed levels set during the 2014 peak levels with Rainy Lake now above the 1950 peak. Lake levels are displaying recessions and are expected to continue decreasing. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in north central Minnesota, Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until further notice * IMPACTS...Flooding of lakes, rivers, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 PM CDT, emergency management reported ongoing extensive flooding. - On Monday June 13th. the Namakan Lake level is 1121.9 feet. The level of Namakan Lake is expected to fall by 10 to 12 inches between June 13th and June 20th. On Monday June 13th the Rainy Lake level was 1113.2 feet. The lake level appears to have crested and is falling slightly. The level on Rainy lake is expected to fall by 1.5 to 3 inches between June 13 and June 20th. Below normal precipitation is expected through June 20th. However any additional heavy rain will slow recessions on these lakes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... International Falls, Kabetogama, Crane Lake, Kabetogama Lake, Voyageurs National Park, Rainy Lake East, Rainy Lake West, northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Ranier, Ray, Island View, Ericksburg and Sand Point Lake. - Https://www.weather.gov/dlh/RainyRiverBasin
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
